channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-10815] Master regionserver should be rolling-upgradable
item.description:
In HBASE-10569, two things could affect the rolling-upgrade from a 0.96+ release:

  • Master doesn't have its own info server anymore. It shares the same info server with the regionserver. We can have a setting so that we can start two info servers, one for the master on the original port, and one for the regionserver.
  • Backup master is a regionserver now. So it could hold regions. This could affect some deployment. We can have a setting so that we can prevent backup master from serving any region.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Attached the first patch. It is on RB: https://reviews.apache.org/r/19759/

In the patch, two configurations are added to control if we assign regions to backup masters, and if we start two info servers in M+RS.

In order to reliably not assigning regions to backup masters if so configured, we changed a little on how master create the backup znode, and how server manager adds new server.
Attached v2 that uses a jetty server to redirect request to the old master info server port to the new port.

We are unable to add a new connector to listen on another port to our infoserver instance? e.g. http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6905098/how-to-configure-jetty-to-listen-to-multiple-ports Can we not add this connector:


+    masterJettyServer.addConnector(connector);

to the existing instance?

Add this to hbase-default.xml I'd say and to the release notes "hbase.master.infoserver.redirect". Turn it off in tests?

This is good: + masterJettyServer.setStopAtShutdown(true);

Is it turned off for tests?

This is good too:

  • conf.getInt("hbase.regionservers", 1), LocalHMaster.class, HRegionServer.class);
    + conf.getInt("hbase.regionservers", 0), LocalHMaster.class, HRegionServer.class);

I'd think that this would be true by default?

+ usingBackupMasters = conf.getBoolean("hbase.balancer.use-backupmaster", false);

...and is the new master server on by default? I'd hope so.

Is this right?

+ if (st == null || usingBackupMasters) return;

We return if we are using backup masters?... or am I misreading what public void setClusterStatus(ClusterStatus st) { is about?

What is happening here?

masterServerName = masterServices.getServerName();
+ excludedServers.remove(masterServerName);

What will the default set up be after this patch goes in? backup masters are used r not? master regionserver will be up by default or not?

Should we be getting this from zk?

+ int masterInfoPort = conf.getInt(HConstants.MASTER_INFO_PORT,
+ HConstants.DEFAULT_MASTER_INFOPORT);
+ conf.setInt("hbase.master.info.port.orig", masterInfoPort);

Patch looks good.

I uploaded the patch to RB, which is convenient when it works.

We are unable to add a new connector to listen on another port to our infoserver instance?

Our infoserver extends the hadoop HttpServer. I could not find a way to add a new connector. With vanilla jetty server, it's very easy to do.

Add this to hbase-default.xml I'd say and to the release notes "hbase.master.infoserver.redirect". Turn it off in tests?

Sure. Will add it to hbase-default.xml. We don't need to turn it off. It is already off for tests both m/rs web UI are already off for tests.

I'd think that this would be true by default?
+ usingBackupMasters = conf.getBoolean("hbase.balancer.use-backupmaster", false);
...and is the new master server on by default? I'd hope so.

By default, the new master server is on, and backup masters don't host any region. So that it won't be any surprise to users.

Is this right?
+ if (st == null || usingBackupMasters) return;
We return if we are using backup masters?... or am I misreading what public void setClusterStatus(ClusterStatus st) { is about?

Yes, this is right. If using backup masters, we don't put them in the excluded server list. Originally, this method does nothing in the base class.

What is happening here?
masterServerName = masterServices.getServerName();
+ excludedServers.remove(masterServerName);

Since the master starts as a backup master at first now, to be safe, here we are trying to make sure the active master in not on the excluded server list. The balancer logic will make sure only meta/namespace/.. are assigned to it.

What will the default set up be after this patch goes in? backup masters are used r not? master regionserver will be up by default or not?

With this patch, by default, backup masters are not used, the redirect jetty server in m+rs is up.

Should we be getting this from zk?
+ int masterInfoPort = conf.getInt(HConstants.MASTER_INFO_PORT,
+ HConstants.DEFAULT_MASTER_INFOPORT);
+ conf.setInt("hbase.master.info.port.orig", masterInfoPort);

The infoport is not in ZK, right?

+1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12637565/hbase-10815_v2.patch
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12637565

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 3 new or modified tests.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/9133//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/9133//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-protocol.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/9133//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-thrift.html

Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/9133//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-server.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/9133//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-hadoop-compat.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/9133//console

This message is automatically generated.

Our infoserver extends the hadoop HttpServer. I could not find a way to add a new connector. With vanilla jetty server, it's very easy to do.

File a follow on? We are to undo our dependency on hadoop infoserver and do our own. Then you could have one webserver instance only?

By default, the new master server is on, and backup masters don't host any region. So that it won't be any surprise to users.

My thinking is that we foreground it in release notes and in notes on upgrade to new version "LISTEN! Masters and backup masters now carry some regions!!Unable to render embedded object: File (". Have backup servers only carry a few reigions... not as many as a pure RS, but not have them stand idle. Lets make the move over to the new world... not pussy-foot it) not found. You have to do configuration if you want the old world but default is new way of doing things? (CM can configure other than defaults?)

The RS infoport is in ZK that I remember. Not the servers. So you may be good.

I'd be +1 if you make it so backup masters carry some regions – a few – and you file a followup to undo our separate instance webserver just to carry a redirect when we bring in the infoserver.

Good on you Jimmy.

How about we file two followup and let this patch in (add the new configuration parameters in hbase-default.xml, enable backup masters to host regions by default)? One followup is to fix the infoserver. The other followup is to make StochasticLoadBalancer adjustable so that we can tune the number of regions to assign to each backup master, since it's better to be in a separate jira.
Filed followup issue HBASE-10873 and HBASE-10874. Integrated info trunk. Thanks Stack for the review.

SUCCESS: Integrated in HBase-TRUNK #5052 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/5052/)
